text: Opogona trichoceros is a moth of the family Tineidae. It is found in New Guinea. The wingspan is about 13 mm. The forewings are dark purplish-fuscous with an orange-yellow elongate mark on the costa about one-third and an orange-yellow subquadrate blotch on the dorsum towards the base, its upper posterior angle produced into a long pointed projection. The hindwings are dark fuscous, the basal half orange-yellow, the division suffused.Exotic Microlep. 4: 8 ==References== Category:Opogona Category:Moths described in 1930 Category:Moths of New Guinea Category:Taxa named by Edward Meyrick
title: Opogona trichoceros
